column21:
Well, I am fully aware of IEC units, and I prefer using them by myself. In Linux. But, Windows uses JEDEC unit system, and the users can be confused by another unit system ("kibibyte? What is this?").
Maybe, it is worth using IEC units in Linux, JEDEC in Windows and decimal SI in macOS?

column20:
Bumps conan from 1.24.1 to 1.25.0.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.25.0 (06-May-2020)

Feature: Consume settings_build to get the value of the OS and arch from the build machine (only when --profile:build is provided). (conan-io/conan#6916). Docs: 📃
Feature: Implements cpp_info.components dependencies. (conan-io/conan#6871). Docs: 📃
Feature: Change HTML output for conan search --table command. (conan-io/conan#6832). Docs: 📃
Feature: Execute periodic config install command. (conan-io/conan#6824). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add build_modules to markdown generator output. (conan-io/conan#6800)
Feature: Resume interrupted file downloads if server supports it. (conan-io/conan#6791)
Feature: Using CONAN_V2_MODE the version attribute in a ConanFile is always a string (already documented). (conan-io/conan#6782). Docs: 📃
Feature: Support GCC 9.3. (conan-io/conan#6772). Docs: 📃
Feature: Populate settings_build and settings_target in conanfile (only if provided --profile:build). (conan-io/conan#6769). Docs: 📃
Feature: handle C++ standard for Intel C++ compiler (conan-io/conan#6766)
Feature: add Intel 19.1 (2020). (conan-io/conan#6733)
Fix: tools.unix_path is noop in all platforms but Windows (already documented behavior). (conan-io/conan#6935)
Fix: Preserve symbolic links for deploy generator. (conan-io/conan#6922). Docs: 📃
Fix: Adds missing version GCC 10 to default settings. (conan-io/conan#6911). Docs: 📃
Fix: Populate requires returned by the servers from the search endpoint using requires (Artifactory) or full_requires (conan_server) fields. (conan-io/conan#6861)
Fix: Avoid failures that happen when Conan runs in a non-existing folder. (conan-io/conan#6825)
Fix: Use pep508 environment markers for defining Conan pip requirements. (conan-io/conan#6798)
Fix: Improve error message when [options] are not specified correctly in conanfile.txt. (conan-io/conan#6794)
Fix: add missing compiler version check for Intel. (conan-io/conan#6734)
Bugfix: Prevent crash when mixing package_id modes for the same dependency. (conan-io/conan#6947)
BugFix: Propagate arch parameter to tools.vcvars_command() in MSBuild() build helper. (conan-io/conan#6928)
Bugfix: Fix the output of conan info package folder when using build_id() method. (conan-io/conan#6917)
Bugfix: Generate correct PACKAGE_VERSION in cmake_find_package_multi generator for multi-config packages. (conan-io/conan#6914)
Bugfix: enable C++20 on Apple Clang. (conan-io/conan#6858)
Bugfix: Variable package_name in conan new -t \<template> command contains a CamelCase version of the name of the package. (conan-io/conan#6821). Docs: 📃
Bugfix: Changed the CMake generator template to properly handle exelinkflags and sharedlinkflags using generator expressions. (conan-io/conan#6780)




Commits

da8e176 add intel 19.1 to migration settings
7ec25e1 fix format
33503fd add new settings
98c3aa6 change version
0f1bd5a fix package_id computation for mixed modes (#6947)
e498cef skip flaky test in py27
90d825a Fix: make instructions more reliable (#6934)
aa5c66e run tools.unix_path only in Windows (#6935)
1ae0b41 fix typo in help message (#6937)
3cea43f Propagate arch parameter to vcvars in msbuild helper (#6928)
Additional commits viewable in compare view

column20:
Bumps pre-commit from 2.3.0 to 2.4.0.

Release notes
Sourced from pre-commit's releases.

pre-commit v2.4.0
Features

Add support for post-commit hooks

#1415 PR by @ModischFabrications.
#1411 issue by @ModischFabrications.


Silence pip version warning in python installation error

#1412 PR by @asottile.


Improve python healthy() when upgrading operating systems.

#1431 PR by @asottile.
#1427 issue by @ahonnecke.


language: python_venv is now an alias to language: python (and will be removed in a future version).

#1431 PR by @asottile.


Speed up python healthy() check.

#1431 PR by @asottile.


pre-commit autoupdate now tries to maintain quoting style of rev.

#1435 PR by @marcjay.
#1434 issue by @marcjay.



Fixes

Fix installation of go modules in repo: local.

#1428 PR by @scop.


Fix committing with unstaged files and a failing post-checkout hook.

#1422 PR by @domodwyer.
#1418 issue by @domodwyer.


Fix installation of node hooks with system node installed on freebsd.

#1443 PR by @asottile.
#1440 issue by @jockej.


Fix ruby hooks when GEM_PATH is set globally.

#1442 PR by @tdeo.


Improve error message when pre-commit autoupdate / pre-commit migrate-config are run but the pre-commit configuration is not valid yaml.

#1448 PR by @asottile.
#1447 issue by @rpdelaney.

👋 Dependabot is moving natively into GitHub! This pull request migrates your configuration from Dependabot.com to a config file, using the new syntax. When you merge this pull request, we'll swap out dependabot-preview (me) for a new dependabot app, and you'll be all set!
With this change, you'll now use the Dependabot page in GitHub, rather than the Dependabot dashboard, to monitor your version updates. Dependabot is now configured exclusively using config files.
If you've got any questions or feedback for us, please let us know by creating an issue in the dependabot/feedback repository.
Learn more about the relaunch of Dependabot
Please note that regular @dependabot commands do not work on this pull request.

column20:
Bumps conan from 1.25.2 to 1.26.0.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.26.0 (10-Jun-2020)

Feature: Expose msvs_toolset tool. (conan-io/conan#7134). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add components to cmake_find_package generator. (conan-io/conan#7108). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add stdcpp_library tool. (conan-io/conan#7082). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add remove_files_by_mask helper (conan-io/conan#7080). Docs: 📃
Feature: New toolchain() recipe method, as a new paradigm for integrating build systems, and simplifying developer flows. (conan-io/conan#7076). Docs: 📃
Feature: New experimental msvc generator that generates a .props file per dependency and is also multi-configuration. (conan-io/conan#7035). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add conan config init command. (conan-io/conan#6959). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add export() and export_sources() methods, that provide the self.copy() helper to add files to recipe or sources in the same way as the corresponding attributes. (conan-io/conan#6945). Docs: 📃
Feature: Allow access to self.name and self.version in set_name() and set_version() methods. (conan-io/conan#6940). Docs: 📃
Feature: Use a template approach for the html and dot output of the Conan graph. (conan-io/conan#6833)
Feature: Handle C++ standard flag for Intel C++ compiler. (conan-io/conan#6766)
Feature: Call compilervars.sh within CMake helper (Intel C++). (conan-io/conan#6735). Docs: 📃
Feature: Pass command to Runner as a sequence instead of string. (conan-io/conan#5583). Docs: 📃
Fix: JSON-serialize sets as a list when using conan inspect --json. (conan-io/conan#7151)
Fix: Update the lockfile passed as an argument to the install command instead of the default conan.lock. (conan-io/conan#7127)
Fix: Adding a package as editable stores full path to conanfile.py. (conan-io/conan#7079)
Fix: Fix broken test PkgGeneratorTest. (conan-io/conan#7065)
Fix: Fix wrong naming of variables in the pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7059)
Fix: Do not modify scm attribute when the origin remote cannot be deduced. (conan-io/conan#7048)
Fix: vcvars_dict should accept a conanfile too. (conan-io/conan#7010). Docs: 📃
Fix: conan config install can overwrite read-only files and won't copy permissions. (conan-io/conan#7004)
Fix: Better error message for missing binaries, including multiple "--build=xxx" outputs. (conan-io/conan#7003)
Fix: Add quotes to folders to accept paths with spaces when calling pyinstaller. (conan-io/conan#6955)
Fix: Previously conan always set cpp_std option in meson project, even if cppstd option was not set in conan profile. Now it sets the option only if cppstd profile option has a concrete value. (conan-io/conan#6895)
Fix: Handle compiler flags for Intel C++ (AutoToolsBuildEnvironment, Meson). (conan-io/conan#6819)
Fix: Set the default CMake generator and toolset for Intel C++. (conan-io/conan#6804)
Bugfix: Fix iOS CMake architecture. (conan-io/conan#7164)
Bugfix: Getting attribute of self.deps_user_info["dep"] now raise AttributeError instead of a (wrong) KeyError, enabling hasattr() and correct getattr() behaviors. (conan-io/conan#7131)
Bugfix: Fix crash while computing the package_id of a package when different package_id_mode are mixed and include package_revision_mode. (conan-io/conan#7051)
Bugfix: Do not allow uploading packages with missing information in the scm attribute. (conan-io/conan#7048)
Bugfix: Fixes an issue where Apple Framework lookup wasn't working on RelWithDebInfo CMake build types. (conan-io/conan#7024)
Bugfix: Do not check patch compiler version in the cmake generators. (conan-io/conan#6976)




Commits

d3da5b8 update migrations settings
4195478 update migrations settings
e6bfe58 Bugfix: fix iOS CMake architecture #7157 (#7164)
27985ef set version 1.26.0
054bad3 'conan inspect': json-serialize sets as lists (#7151)
c923c69 Poc/toolchain simpler (#7076)
471a2a0 - handle compiler flags for Intel C++ (#6819)
0001620 Add components to cmake_find_package generator (jinja2) (#7108)
0eea418 Avoid need to quote arguments for commands running without a shell (#5578) (#...
4321cf5 New msbuild generator that creates 1 .props file per dependency (multi-config...

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.26.0 (10-Jun-2020)

Feature: Expose msvs_toolset tool. (conan-io/conan#7134). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add components to cmake_find_package generator. (conan-io/conan#7108). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add stdcpp_library tool. (conan-io/conan#7082). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add remove_files_by_mask helper (conan-io/conan#7080). Docs: 📃
Feature: New toolchain() recipe method, as a new paradigm for integrating build systems, and simplifying developer flows. (conan-io/conan#7076). Docs: 📃
Feature: New experimental msvc generator that generates a .props file per dependency and is also multi-configuration. (conan-io/conan#7035). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add conan config init command. (conan-io/conan#6959). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add export() and export_sources() methods, that provide the self.copy() helper to add files to recipe or sources in the same way as the corresponding attributes. (conan-io/conan#6945). Docs: 📃
Feature: Allow access to self.name and self.version in set_name() and set_version() methods. (conan-io/conan#6940). Docs: 📃
Feature: Use a template approach for the html and dot output of the Conan graph. (conan-io/conan#6833)
Feature: Handle C++ standard flag for Intel C++ compiler. (conan-io/conan#6766)
Feature: Call compilervars.sh within CMake helper (Intel C++). (conan-io/conan#6735). Docs: 📃
Feature: Pass command to Runner as a sequence instead of string. (conan-io/conan#5583). Docs: 📃
Fix: JSON-serialize sets as a list when using conan inspect --json. (conan-io/conan#7151)
Fix: Update the lockfile passed as an argument to the install command instead of the default conan.lock. (conan-io/conan#7127)
Fix: Adding a package as editable stores full path to conanfile.py. (conan-io/conan#7079)
Fix: Fix broken test PkgGeneratorTest. (conan-io/conan#7065)
Fix: Fix wrong naming of variables in the pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7059)
Fix: Do not modify scm attribute when the origin remote cannot be deduced. (conan-io/conan#7048)
Fix: vcvars_dict should accept a conanfile too. (conan-io/conan#7010). Docs: 📃
Fix: conan config install can overwrite read-only files and won't copy permissions. (conan-io/conan#7004)
Fix: Better error message for missing binaries, including multiple "--build=xxx" outputs. (conan-io/conan#7003)
Fix: Add quotes to folders to accept paths with spaces when calling pyinstaller. (conan-io/conan#6955)
Fix: Previously conan always set cpp_std option in meson project, even if cppstd option was not set in conan profile. Now it sets the option only if cppstd profile option has a concrete value. (conan-io/conan#6895)
Fix: Handle compiler flags for Intel C++ (AutoToolsBuildEnvironment, Meson). (conan-io/conan#6819)
Fix: Set the default CMake generator and toolset for Intel C++. (conan-io/conan#6804)
Bugfix: Fix iOS CMake architecture. (conan-io/conan#7164)
Bugfix: Getting attribute of self.deps_user_info["dep"] now raise AttributeError instead of a (wrong) KeyError, enabling hasattr() and correct getattr() behaviors. (conan-io/conan#7131)
Bugfix: Fix crash while computing the package_id of a package when different package_id_mode are mixed and include package_revision_mode. (conan-io/conan#7051)
Bugfix: Do not allow uploading packages with missing information in the scm attribute. (conan-io/conan#7048)
Bugfix: Fixes an issue where Apple Framework lookup wasn't working on RelWithDebInfo CMake build types. (conan-io/conan#7024)
Bugfix: Do not check patch compiler version in the cmake generators. (conan-io/conan#6976)




Commits

d3da5b8 update migrations settings
4195478 update migrations settings
e6bfe58 Bugfix: fix iOS CMake architecture #7157 (#7164)
27985ef set version 1.26.0
054bad3 'conan inspect': json-serialize sets as lists (#7151)
c923c69 Poc/toolchain simpler (#7076)
471a2a0 - handle compiler flags for Intel C++ (#6819)
0001620 Add components to cmake_find_package generator (jinja2) (#7108)
0eea418 Avoid need to quote arguments for commands running without a shell (#5578) (#...
4321cf5 New msbuild generator that creates 1 .props file per dependency (multi-config...

column20:
Bumps conan from 1.26.0 to 1.27.0.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.27.0 (01-Jul-2020)

Feature: (Only if using two profiles) Information from the self.user_info field is provided to consumers: information from the host context is accessible via deps_user_info attribute,  and information from the build context via user_info_build attribute. (conan-io/conan#7266). Docs: 📃
Feature: New conan config install --list and conan config install --remove=index arguments to display and remove conan config install origins. (conan-io/conan#7263). Docs: 📃
Feature: Support components for cmake_find_package_multi generator. (conan-io/conan#7259). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add Pop!_OS to the list of APT based distributions. (conan-io/conan#7237)
Feature: Use Bootstrap in search table template style. (conan-io/conan#7224)
Feature: Added support for template dir in conan new. (conan-io/conan#7215). Docs: 📃
Feature: Configuration for checking the required Conan client version. (conan-io/conan#7183). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds tool to fix symlinks in the package_folder. (conan-io/conan#7178). Docs: 📃
Feature: Templates for conan search --table and conan info --graph can be overridden by the user. (conan-io/conan#7176). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add support for the CLICOLOR/CLICOLOR_FORCE/NO_COLOR output colorization control variables. (conan-io/conan#7154). Docs: 📃
Fix: Remove message from the qmake generator. (conan-io/conan#7228)
Fix: Allow --build=Pkg/0.1@ to match the Pkg/0.1 package, so the conan install Pkg/0.1@ --build=Pkg/0.1@ also works. (conan-io/conan#7219)
Fix: Improve error message when svn or git are not in the installed or in the path. (conan-io/conan#7194)
Fix: Graph created for the test_package/conanfile.py recipe takes the profile:build if given. (conan-io/conan#7182)
Fix: Define user variables in the conan_toolchain.cmake file, not in the project-include file. (conan-io/conan#7160)
Fix: Set toolset for MSBuild in case of Intel C++. (conan-io/conan#6809)
Bugfix: Allow to extend classes with python_requires_extend from packages that contain "." dots in the package name. (conan-io/conan#7262)
Bugfix: Correctly inherit scm definitions from python_requires base classes. (conan-io/conan#7238)
Bugfix: Change GNU triplet for iOS, watchOS, tvOS to allow simulator builds. (conan-io/conan#6748)
SCM mode with scm_to_conandata and revisions marked as stable. Docs: 📃

1.26.1 (23-Jun-2020)

Fix: Add missing migrations. (conan-io/conan#7213)
Fix: Packages listed as build_requires in recipes that belong to the host context don't add as build_requires those listed in the host profile. (conan-io/conan#7169)




Commits

e34a52b Components support for cmake_find_package_multi generator (#7259)
abc1be3 Merge pull request #7154 from kchmck/feature/color-controls
e67c01a refactor tests
64599cf [fix] Use 'profile_build' (if given) to create graph for the test_package fun...
a312aef [xbuild] Provide "user_info" from every context (#7266)
023b881 test toolchain configs (#7160)
d40f2a9 - change GNU triplet for iOS, watchOS, tvOS to allow simulator builds (#6748)
bcc253b #7271 Fix empty config list (#7272)
82f2937 Add a tool to fix_symlinks: remove broken ones and relativize all of them (#7...

column21: Looks like conan is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.0.3.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.0.3 - July 4, 2020

Fixed setup.py command incorrectly passing check=True as a configuration parameter (see: timothycrosley/isort#1258)
Fixed missing patch version
Fixed issue #1253: Atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream

5.0.2
Ensure completeness of black profile, adding default line_length
5.0.1
No release notes provided.
5.0.0
https://timothycrosley.github.io/isort/docs/major_releases/introducing_isort_5/
4.3.21-2
4.3.21 - June 25, 2019 - hot fix release

Fixed issue #957 - Long aliases and use_parentheses generates invalid syntax




Changelog
Sourced from isort's changelog.

5.0.3 - July 4, 2020

Fixed setup.py command incorrectly passing check=True as a configuration parameter (see: timothycrosley/isort#1258)
Fixed missing patch version
Fixed issue #1253: Atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream

5.0.2 - July 4, 2020

Ensured black profile was complete, adding missing line_length definition.

5.0.1 - July 4, 2020

Fixed a runtime error in a vendored dependency (toml).

5.0.0 Penny - July 4, 2020
Breaking changes:

isort now requires Python 3.6+ to run but continues to support formatting on ALL versions of python including
Python 2 code.
isort deprecates official support for Python 3.4, removing modules only in this release from known_standard_library:

user


Config files are no longer composed on-top of each-other. Instead the first config file found is used.

Since there is no longer composition negative form settings (such as --dont-skip) are no longer required and have been removed.


Two-letter shortened setting names (like ac for atomic) now require two dashes to avoid ambiguity: --ac.
For consistency with other tools -v now is shorthand for verbose and -V is shorthand for version. See Issue: #1067.
length_sort_{section_name} config usage has been deprecated. Instead length_sort_sections list can be used to specify a list of sections that need to be length sorted.
safety_excludes and unsafe have been deprecated
Config now includes as default full set of safety directories defined by safety excludes.
--recursive option has been removed. Directories passed in are now automatically sorted recursive.
--apply option has been removed as it is the default behaviour.
isort now does nothing, beyond giving instructions and exiting status code 0, when ran with no arguments.

a new --interactive flag has been added to enable the old style behaviour.


isort now works on contiguous sections of imports, instead of one whole file at a time.
isort now formats all nested "as" imports in the "from" form. import x.y as a becomes from x import y as a.
keep_direct_and_as_imports option now defaults to True.
appdirs is no longer supported. Unless manually specified, config should be project config only.
toml is now installed as a vendorized module, meaning pyproject.toml based config is always supported.
Completely new Python API, old version is removed and no longer accessible.
New module placement logic and module fully replaces old finders. Old approach is still available via --old-finders.

Internal:


isort now utilizes mypy and typing to filter out typing related issues before deployment.


isort now utilizes black internally to ensure more consistent formatting.


profile support for common project types (black, django, google, etc)


Much much more. There is some difficulty in fully capturing the extent of changes in this release - just because of how all encompassing the release is. See: Github Issues for more.





Commits

5ab7fa6 Bump version
352cbad Update changelog to include issue #1253 fix
ccfb206 Fix issue #1253: atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream
6354730 Fix issue #1256 no documentation for Force Alphabetical Sort Within Sections
0242e76 Merge pull request #1257 from hukkinj1/update-extra-names
51f050e Update optional feature names in README
3baa821 Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort into develop
6e5da55 Add Taneli Hukkinen (@hukkinj1) to documenters list
1c24e30 Merge pull request #1250 from hukkinj1/develop
1a74870 Remove references to removed isort[pyproject] extra in README
Additional commits viewable in compare view

isort now requires Python 3.6+ to run but continues to support formatting on ALL versions of python including
Python 2 code.
isort deprecates official support for Python 3.4, removing modules only in this release from known_standard_library:

user


Config files are no longer composed on-top of each-other. Instead the first config file found is used.

Since there is no longer composition negative form settings (such as --dont-skip or it's config file variant not_skip) are no longer required and have been removed.


Two-letter shortened setting names (like ac for atomic) now require two dashes to avoid ambiguity: --ac.
For consistency with other tools -v now is shorthand for verbose and -V is shorthand for version. See Issue: #1067.
length_sort_{section_name} config usage has been deprecated. Instead length_sort_sections list can be used to specify a list of sections that need to be length sorted.
safety_excludes and unsafe have been deprecated
Config now includes as default full set of safety directories defined by safety excludes.
--recursive option has been removed. Directories passed in are now automatically sorted recursive.
--apply option has been removed as it is the default behaviour.
isort now does nothing, beyond giving instructions and exiting status code 0, when ran with no arguments.

a new --interactive flag has been added to enable the old style behaviour.


isort now works on contiguous sections of imports, instead of one whole file at a time.
isort now formats all nested "as" imports in the "from" form. import x.y as a becomes from x import y as a.
keep_direct_and_as_imports option now defaults to True.
appdirs is no longer supported. Unless manually specified, config should be project config only.
toml is now installed as a vendorized module, meaning pyproject.toml based config is always supported.
Completely new Python API, old version is removed and no longer accessible.
New module placement logic and module fully replaces old finders. Old approach is still available via --old-finders.

Internal:


isort now utilizes mypy and typing to filter out typing related issues before deployment.


isort now utilizes black internally to ensure more consistent formatting.


profile support for common project types (black, django, google, etc)


Much much more. There is some difficulty in fully capturing the extent of changes in this release - just because of how all encompassing the release is. See: Github Issues for more.





Commits

defefc2 Add pragma no cover to deprecated flags check
f6ca70e Bump version to 5.0.4
77628b8 Update option documentation
fdf9d2e Add upgrade guide
a9048af Add upgrade guide
4c72396 Remove some no longer accurate documentation sections
8a02fab Merge pull request #1274 from timothycrosley/issue/1264
78d354d Fix issue 1264 - removing duplicate handling of comments for section sorting
686d3c7 Add regression test for issue #1264 demonstrating failure
a3a7251 Add - Kosei Kitahara (@Surgo) to acknowledgements
Additional commits viewable in compare view

column21:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.0.6.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.0.6

Fixed #1302: comments and --trailing-comma can generate invalid code.
Fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by a comment.
Fixed #1304: isort 5 no longer recognises sre_parse as a stdlib module.
Fixed #1300: add_imports moves comments following import section.
Fixed #1276: Fix a bug that creates only one line after triple quotes.

5.0.5 July 7, 2020

Fixed #1285: packaging issue with bundling tests via poetry.
Fixed #1284: Regression when sorting .pyi files from CLI using black profile.
Fixed #1275 & #1283: Blank line after docstring removed.
Fixed #1298: CLI Help out of date with isort 5.
Fixed #1290: Unecessary blank lines above nested imports when import comments turned on.
Fixed #1297: Usage of --add-imports alongside --check is broken.
Fixed #1289: Stream usage no longer auto picking up config file from current working directory.
Fixed #1296: Force_single_line setting removes immediately following comment line.
Fixed #1295: ensure_newline_before_comments doesnt work with force_sort_within_sections.
Setting not_skip will no longer immediately fail but instead give user a warning and direct
to upgrade docs.

5.0.4
No release notes provided.
5.0.3 - July 4, 2020

Fixed setup.py command incorrectly passing check=True as a configuration parameter (see: timothycrosley/isort#1258)
Fixed missing patch version
Fixed issue #1253: Atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream

5.0.2
Ensure completeness of black profile, adding default line_length
5.0.1
No release notes provided.
5.0.0
https://timothycrosley.github.io/isort/docs/major_releases/introducing_isort_5/
4.3.21-2
4.3.21 - June 25, 2019 - hot fix release

Fixed issue #957 - Long aliases and use_parentheses generates invalid syntax




Changelog
Sourced from isort's changelog.

5.0.6 July 8, 2020

Fixed #1302: comments and --trailing-comma can generate invalid code.
Fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by a comment.
Fixed #1304: isort 5 no longer recognises sre_parse as a stdlib module.
Fixed #1300: add_imports moves comments following import section.
Fixed #1276: Fix a bug that creates only one line after triple quotes.

5.0.5 July 7, 2020

Fixed #1285: packaging issue with bundling tests via poetry.
Fixed #1284: Regression when sorting .pyi files from CLI using black profile.
Fixed #1275 & #1283: Blank line after docstring removed.
Fixed #1298: CLI Help out of date with isort 5.
Fixed #1290: Unecessary blank lines above nested imports when import comments turned on.
Fixed #1297: Usage of --add-imports alongside --check is broken.
Fixed #1289: Stream usage no longer auto picking up config file from current working directory.
Fixed #1296: Force_single_line setting removes immediately following comment line.
Fixed #1295: ensure_newline_before_comments doesnt work with force_sort_within_sections.
Setting not_skip will no longer immediately fail but instead give user a warning and direct
to upgrade docs.

5.0.4 July 6, 2020

Fixed #1264: a regression with comment handling and force_sort_within_sections config option
Added warning for deprecated CLI flags and linked to upgrade guide.

5.0.3 - July 4, 2020

Fixed setup.py command incorrectly passing check=True as a configuration parameter (see: timothycrosley/isort#1258)
Fixed missing patch version
Fixed issue #1253: Atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream

5.0.2 - July 4, 2020

Ensured black profile was complete, adding missing line_length definition.

5.0.1 - July 4, 2020

Fixed a runtime error in a vendored dependency (toml).

5.0.0 Penny - July 4, 2020
Breaking changes:

isort now requires Python 3.6+ to run but continues to support formatting on ALL versions of python including
Python 2 code.
isort deprecates official support for Python 3.4, removing modules only in this release from known_standard_library:

user


Config files are no longer composed on-top of each-other. Instead the first config file found is used.

Since there is no longer composition negative form settings (such as --dont-skip or it's config file variant not_skip) are no longer required and have been removed.


Two-letter shortened setting names (like ac for atomic) now require two dashes to avoid ambiguity: --ac.
For consistency with other tools -v now is shorthand for verbose and -V is shorthand for version. See Issue: #1067.
length_sort_{section_name} config usage has been deprecated. Instead length_sort_sections list can be used to specify a list of sections that need to be length sorted.
safety_excludes and unsafe have been deprecated
Config now includes as default full set of safety directories defined by safety excludes.
--recursive option has been removed. Directories passed in are now automatically sorted recursive.





Commits

e0c6175 Bump version to 5.0.6
b82969d Add Seung Hyeon, Kim (@hyeonjames) to acknowledgements
2120836 Add additional test cases
2b57c9e Merge pull request #1299 from hyeonjames/issue-1276
7daceb6 Fixed #1300: add_imports moves comments following import section.
9ee7a97 Fixed #1304: isort 5 no longer recognises  as a stdlib module.
340713c Fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by...
2e21943 Fixed
e00418b Only show examples if present in docs, at least until examples are more prele...
07a4d82 Print used isort versin to console for live editor, use black profile by default
Additional commits viewable in compare view

5.0.0
https://timothycrosley.github.io/isort/docs/major_releases/introducing_isort_5/
4.3.21-2
4.3.21 - June 25, 2019 - hot fix release




Changelog
Sourced from isort's changelog.

5.0.9 July 11, 2020

Fixed #1301: Import headings in nested sections leads to check errors

5.0.8 July 11, 2020

Fixed #1277 & #1278: New line detection issues on Windows.
Fixed #1294: Fix bundled git hook.

5.0.7 July 9, 2020

Fixed #1306: unexpected --diff behavior.
Fixed #1279: Fixed NOQA comment regression.

5.0.6 July 8, 2020

Fixed #1302: comments and --trailing-comma can generate invalid code.
Fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by a comment.
Fixed #1304: isort 5 no longer recognises sre_parse as a stdlib module.
Fixed #1300: add_imports moves comments following import section.
Fixed #1276: Fix a bug that creates only one line after triple quotes.

5.0.5 July 7, 2020

Fixed #1285: packaging issue with bundling tests via poetry.
Fixed #1284: Regression when sorting .pyi files from CLI using black profile.
Fixed #1275 & #1283: Blank line after docstring removed.
Fixed #1298: CLI Help out of date with isort 5.
Fixed #1290: Unecessary blank lines above nested imports when import comments turned on.
Fixed #1297: Usage of --add-imports alongside --check is broken.
Fixed #1289: Stream usage no longer auto picking up config file from current working directory.
Fixed #1296: Force_single_line setting removes immediately following comment line.
Fixed #1295: ensure_newline_before_comments doesnt work with force_sort_within_sections.
Setting not_skip will no longer immediately fail but instead give user a warning and direct
to upgrade docs.

5.0.4 July 6, 2020

Fixed #1264: a regression with comment handling and force_sort_within_sections config option
Added warning for deprecated CLI flags and linked to upgrade guide.

5.0.3 - July 4, 2020

Fixed setup.py command incorrectly passing check=True as a configuration parameter (see: timothycrosley/isort#1258)
Fixed missing patch version
Fixed issue #1253: Atomic fails when passed in not readable output stream

5.0.2 - July 4, 2020

Ensured black profile was complete, adding missing line_length definition.

5.0.1 - July 4, 2020

Fixed a runtime error in a vendored dependency (toml).

5.0.0 Penny - July 4, 2020
Breaking changes:

isort now requires Python 3.6+ to run but continues to support formatting on ALL versions of python including





Commits

046a62f Bump version to 5.0.8
37fb75c Add upgrade guide for known_standard_library
c548602 Fixed #1294: bundled git hook broken in V5.
c7ea8ec Formatting
90617aa Fixed #1277 & #1278: New line detection issues on Windows.
d36e915 Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort into develop
a1639c7 Update 4.-acknowledgements.md
e56b933 Merge pull request #1308 from gdalmau/patch-1
f99bffd Fix typo in plone profile
f82d3da Fix terminal usage examples
Additional commits viewable in compare view

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.1.0 July 14, 2020

isort now throws an exception if an invalid settings path is given (issue #1174).
Implemented support for automatic redundant alias removal (issue #1281).
Implemented experimental support for floating all imports to the top of a file (issue #1228)
Fixed #1178: support for semicolons in decorators.
Fixed #1315: Extra newline before comment with -n + --fss.
Fixed #1192: -k or --keep-direct-and-as-imports option has been deprecated as it is now always on.

Formatting changes implied:

to upgrade docs.

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.1.3.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.1.3 July 18, 2020

Fixed issue #1329: Fix comments duplicated when --fass option is set.

5.1.2 July 17, 2020

Fixed issue #1219 / #1326: Comments not wrapped for long lines
Fixed issue #1156: Bug related to isort:skip usage followed by a multiline comment block

5.1.1 July 15, 2020

Fixed issue #1322: Occasionally two extra newlines before comment with -n & --fss.
Fixed issue #1189: --diff broken when reading from standard input.

5.1.0 July 14, 2020

isort now throws an exception if an invalid settings path is given (issue #1174).
Implemented support for automatic redundant alias removal (issue #1281).
Implemented experimental support for floating all imports to the top of a file (issue #1228)
Fixed #1178: support for semicolons in decorators.
Fixed #1315: Extra newline before comment with -n + --fss.
Fixed #1192: -k or --keep-direct-and-as-imports option has been deprecated as it is now always on.

Formatting changes implied:

Fixed #1280: rewrite of as imports changes the behavior of the imports.

5.0.9

Fixed #1301: Import headings in nested sections leads to check errors

5.0.8

Fixed #1277 & #1278: New line detection issues on Windows.
Fixed #1294: Fix bundled git hook.

5.0.7

Fixed #1306: unexpected --diff behavior.
Fixed #1279: Fixed NOQA comment regression.

5.0.6

Fixed #1302: comments and --trailing-comma can generate invalid code.
Fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by a comment.
Fixed #1304: isort 5 no longer recognises sre_parse as a stdlib module.
Fixed #1300: add_imports moves comments following import section.
Fixed #1276: Fix a bug that creates only one line after triple quotes.

5.0.5 July 7, 2020

Fixed #1285: packaging issue with bundling tests via poetry.
Fixed #1284: Regression when sorting .pyi files from CLI using black profile.
Fixed #1275 & #1283: Blank line after docstring removed.
Fixed #1298: CLI Help out of date with isort 5.
Fixed #1290: Unecessary blank lines above nested imports when import comments turned on.
Fixed #1297: Usage of --add-imports alongside --check is broken.
Fixed #1289: Stream usage no longer auto picking up config file from current working directory.
Fixed #1296: Force_single_line setting removes immediately following comment line.
Fixed #1295: ensure_newline_before_comments doesnt work with force_sort_within_sections.

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.2.1.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".

Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.

5.1.4 July 19, 2020

Fixed issue #1333: Use of wrap_length raises an exception about it not being lower or equal to line_length.
Fixed issue #1330: Ensure stdout can be stubbed dynamically for show_unified_diff function.

5.1.3 July 18, 2020

Fixed issue #1329: Fix comments duplicated when --fass option is set.

Fixed issue #1219 / #1326: Comments not wrapped for long lines

5.1.1 July 15, 2020

Fixed issue #1189: --diff broken when reading from standard input.

isort now throws an exception if an invalid settings path is given (issue #1174).
Implemented support for automatic redundant alias removal (issue #1281).
Implemented experimental support for floating all imports to the top of a file (issue #1228)

Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #1020: Option for LOCALFOLDER.
Implemented #1353: Added support for output formatting plugins.
# isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.
Fixed #1348: --diff works incorrectly with files that have CRLF line endings.
Improved code repositories usage of pylint tags (#1350).

5.1.4 July 19, 2020

Fixed issue #1333: Use of wrap_length raises an exception about it not being lower or equal to line_length.
Fixed issue #1330: Ensure stdout can be stubbed dynamically for show_unified_diff function.

5.1.3 July 18, 2020

Fixed issue #1329: Fix comments duplicated when --fass option is set.

5.1.2 July 17, 2020

Fixed issue #1219 / #1326: Comments not wrapped for long lines
Fixed issue #1156: Bug related to isort:skip usage followed by a multiline comment block

5.1.1 July 15, 2020

Fixed issue #1322: Occasionally two extra newlines before comment with -n & --fss.
Fixed issue #1189: --diff broken when reading from standard input.

5.1.0 July 14, 2020

isort now throws an exception if an invalid settings path is given (issue #1174).
Implemented support for automatic redundant alias removal (issue #1281).
Implemented experimental support for floating all imports to the top of a file (issue #1228)
Fixed #1178: support for semicolons in decorators.
Fixed #1315: Extra newline before comment with -n + --fss.
Fixed #1192: -k or --keep-direct-and-as-imports option has been deprecated as it is now always on.

Formatting changes implied:

column20:
Bumps conan from 1.27.0 to 1.28.0.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.28.0 (31-Jul-2020)

Feature: Show Conan version on HTML output. (conan-io/conan#7443). Docs: 📃
Feature: Support for cpp_info.components in pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7413). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds ps1 virtualenv to other OS for use with powershell 7. #7407 (conan-io/conan#7408). Docs: 📃
Feature: Propose init() method to unconditionally initialize class attributes like license or description. (conan-io/conan#7404). Docs: 📃
Feature: add deprecated attribute (conan-io/conan#7399). Docs: 📃
Feature: Allow conan.conf user configuration of paths to client certificate and key, outside of the Conan cache. (conan-io/conan#7398). Docs: 📃
Feature: Document return value of self.copy() in the package() method. (conan-io/conan#7389). Docs: 📃
Feature: Complete cli2.0 framework to handle sub-commands and add conan user command for cli 2.0 (conan-io/conan#7372)
Feature: Implement required_conan_version in conanfile.py, will raise if the current Conan version does not match the defined version range. (conan-io/conan#7360). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add provides attribute to ConanFile: recipes can declare what they provide and Conan will fail if several recipes provide the same functionality (ODR violation). (conan-io/conan#7337). Docs: 📃
Feature: When using CONAN_V2_MODE if build_type or compiler are not defined Conan will raise an error. (conan-io/conan#7327). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds "filenames" to cppinfo attribute, and changes cmake_find_package and cmake_find_package_multi generators so that they support it. (conan-io/conan#7320). Docs: 📃
Feature: Define recipe_folder attribute pointing to the folder containing conanfile.py (conan-io/conan#7314). Docs: 📃
Feature: Checking if a Linux distro uses apt is now based on the existence of apt in the system, instead of checking if the distro currently being used is in a hard-coded list of distros known to use apt. (conan-io/conan#7309)
Feature: Add commands management for cli 2.0. (conan-io/conan#7278)
Feature: Complete revamp of the lockfiles feature. Including version-only lockfiles, partial lockfiles, new command line syntax, improved management of build-order and many pending fixes. (conan-io/conan#7243). Docs: 📃
Feature: More detailed description for --update argument. (conan-io/conan#7167). Docs: 📃
Feature: improve compiler detection for CONAN_V2_MODE. (conan-io/conan#5740). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add settings for clang-cl (clang on Windows). (conan-io/conan#5705). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax pluginbase requirement to pluginbase>=0.5, including latest 1.0.0 . (conan-io/conan#7441)
Fix: Make explicit the file writing of toolchain() helpers, so the method can be used to save custom files. (conan-io/conan#7435). Docs: 📃
Fix: Fixing --help for commands in proposal for command line v2.0. (conan-io/conan#7394)
Fix: Show outdated packages when running search --table. (conan-io/conan#7364). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax msbuild generator to not raise in Linux. (conan-io/conan#7361)
Fix: Conan config install does not trigger scheduled config command. (conan-io/conan#7311)
Fix: Implement missing __contains__ method, so checking if "myoption" in self.info.options is possible in package_id(). (conan-io/conan#7303)
Fix: Build first ocurrence of a node in a lockfile when it is repeated (build requires) (conan-io/conan#7144)
BugFix: Only add User-Agent to headers dict if it was not provided by the user. (conan-io/conan#7390)
Bugfix: cppstd was missing in settings.yml for the qcc compiler and updates to 8.3. (conan-io/conan#7384)
BugFix: Fix missing download of conan_sources.tgz created using export_sources() method. (conan-io/conan#7380)
Bugfix: Intel Compiler install location detection on Windows. (conan-io/conan#7370)
Bugfix: Avoid crash while computing package_id when using package_revision_mode, and also incorrectly using installed binaries and reporting them installed after the re-computation of package_id resolved to a different binary. (conan-io/conan#7353)
Bugfix: cmake_multi generator used with Xcode CMake generator. (conan-io/conan#7341)
Bugfix: Do not fail for conan remove -r remote -p when there are no packages in the remote. (conan-io/conan#7338)
Bugfix: Add system_libs to scons generator. (conan-io/conan#7302)

1.27.1 (10-Jul-2020)

Bugfix: Recover quotes around linker flags in CMake generators, fix failure with Macos frameworks (conan-io/conan#7322)




Commits

5164a74 Hotfix/lockfile errors (#7453)
f529eff version 1.28.0
3658bb1 Refactor filenames and simplify tests (#7447)
b5bdb4b Add Conan version to HTML output (#7443)
efda5f0 [feature] Define file name for CMake find generators (#7320)
314e374 Support for components in pkg_config generator (#7413)
15e4b45 New lockfiles iteration. Including version-only lockfiles. (#7243)
f74fcb0 relax pluginbase requirements (#7441)
3092222 Feature/toolchain without dump (#7435)
f031416 fix migration test
Additional commits viewable in compare view

Feature: When using CONAN_V2_MODE if build_type or compiler are not defined Conan will raise an error. (conan-io/conan#7327). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds "filenames" to cppinfo attribute, and changes cmake_find_package and cmake_find_package_multi generators so that they support it. (conan-io/conan#7320). Docs: 📃
Feature: Define recipe_folder attribute pointing to the folder containing conanfile.py (conan-io/conan#7314). Docs: 📃
Feature: Checking if a Linux distro uses apt is now based on the existence of apt in the system, instead of checking if the distro currently being used is in a hard-coded list of distros known to use apt. (conan-io/conan#7309)
Feature: Add commands management for cli 2.0. (conan-io/conan#7278)
Feature: Complete revamp of the lockfiles feature. Including version-only lockfiles, partial lockfiles, new command line syntax, improved management of build-order and many pending fixes. (conan-io/conan#7243). Docs: 📃
Feature: More detailed description for --update argument. (conan-io/conan#7167). Docs: 📃
Feature: improve compiler detection for CONAN_V2_MODE. (conan-io/conan#5740). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add settings for clang-cl (clang on Windows). (conan-io/conan#5705). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax pluginbase requirement to pluginbase>=0.5, including latest 1.0.0 . (conan-io/conan#7441)
Fix: Make explicit the file writing of toolchain() helpers, so the method can be used to save custom files. (conan-io/conan#7435). Docs: 📃
Fix: Fixing --help for commands in proposal for command line v2.0. (conan-io/conan#7394)
Fix: Show outdated packages when running search --table. (conan-io/conan#7364). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax msbuild generator to not raise in Linux. (conan-io/conan#7361)
Fix: Conan config install does not trigger scheduled config command. (conan-io/conan#7311)
Fix: Implement missing __contains__ method, so checking if "myoption" in self.info.options is possible in package_id(). (conan-io/conan#7303)
Fix: Build first ocurrence of a node in a lockfile when it is repeated (build requires) (conan-io/conan#7144)
BugFix: Only add User-Agent to headers dict if it was not provided by the user. (conan-io/conan#7390)
Bugfix: cppstd was missing in settings.yml for the qcc compiler and updates to 8.3. (conan-io/conan#7384)
BugFix: Fix missing download of conan_sources.tgz created using export_sources() method. (conan-io/conan#7380)
Bugfix: Intel Compiler install location detection on Windows. (conan-io/conan#7370)
Bugfix: Avoid crash while computing package_id when using package_revision_mode, and also incorrectly using installed binaries and reporting them installed after the re-computation of package_id resolved to a different binary. (conan-io/conan#7353)
Bugfix: cmake_multi generator used with Xcode CMake generator. (conan-io/conan#7341)
Bugfix: Do not fail for conan remove -r remote -p when there are no packages in the remote. (conan-io/conan#7338)
Bugfix: Add system_libs to scons generator. (conan-io/conan#7302)

1.27.1 (10-Jul-2020)

Bugfix: Recover quotes around linker flags in CMake generators, fix failure with Macos frameworks (conan-io/conan#7322)




Commits

5164a74 Hotfix/lockfile errors (#7453)
f529eff version 1.28.0
3658bb1 Refactor filenames and simplify tests (#7447)
b5bdb4b Add Conan version to HTML output (#7443)
efda5f0 [feature] Define file name for CMake find generators (#7320)
314e374 Support for components in pkg_config generator (#7413)
15e4b45 New lockfiles iteration. Including version-only lockfiles. (#7243)
f74fcb0 relax pluginbase requirements (#7441)
3092222 Feature/toolchain without dump (#7435)
f031416 fix migration test
Additional commits viewable in compare view

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.3.0.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.3.0 Aug 4, 2020

Implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code (issue #1357)
Implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions (issue #1162)
Implemented ability to specify the types of imports (issue #1181)
Implemented ability to dedup import headings (issue #953)
Added experimental support for sorting literals (issue #1358)
Added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
Improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with Visual Studio Code (issue #1363)
Improved handling of mixed newline forms within same source file.
Improved error handling for known sections.
Improved API consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification API calls to indicate if changes were made.
Fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
Fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink

Internal Development:

Initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors (thanks @Zac-HD!)

5.2.2 July 30, 2020

Fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.
Implemented recursive symlink detection support.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".
Implemented #727: Ability to only add imports if existing imports exist.
Implemented #970: Support for custom sharable isort profiles.
Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #1020: Option for LOCALFOLDER.
Implemented #1353: Added support for output formatting plugins.
# isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.
Fixed #1348: --diff works incorrectly with files that have CRLF line endings.
Improved code repositories usage of pylint tags (#1350).

5.1.4 July 19, 2020

Fixed issue #1333: Use of wrap_length raises an exception about it not being lower or equal to line_length.
Fixed issue #1330: Ensure stdout can be stubbed dynamically for show_unified_diff function.

5.1.3 July 18, 2020

Fixed issue #1329: Fix comments duplicated when --fass option is set.

column20:
Bumps conan from 1.27.0 to 1.28.1.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.28.1 (06-Aug-2020)

Feature: Add user_info_build attribute to txt generator. (conan-io/conan#7488)
Fix: Attribute user_info_build is available for commands in the local development workflow. (conan-io/conan#7488)
Fix: Do not override value of public_deps in pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7482)
Bugfix: correctly set CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT and CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES. (conan-io/conan#7512)
Bugfix: When using build_requires defined in a profile that is passed as profile_host, it was not being applied to build_requires that live in the host context (with force_host_context=True). (conan-io/conan#7500)
Bugfix: Fix broken cmake_find_package_multi when using components, as different configurations were being resolved to the same name, overwriting each other. (conan-io/conan#7492)
Bugfix: Powershell files generated by virtualenv generators use proper path separators. (conan-io/conan#7472)

1.28.0 (31-Jul-2020)

Feature: Show Conan version on HTML output. (conan-io/conan#7443). Docs: 📃
Feature: Support for cpp_info.components in pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7413). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds ps1 virtualenv to other OS for use with powershell 7. #7407 (conan-io/conan#7408). Docs: 📃
Feature: Propose init() method to unconditionally initialize class attributes like license or description. (conan-io/conan#7404). Docs: 📃
Feature: add deprecated attribute (conan-io/conan#7399). Docs: 📃
Feature: Allow conan.conf user configuration of paths to client certificate and key, outside of the Conan cache. (conan-io/conan#7398). Docs: 📃
Feature: Document return value of self.copy() in the package() method. (conan-io/conan#7389). Docs: 📃
Feature: Complete cli2.0 framework to handle sub-commands and add conan user command for cli 2.0 (conan-io/conan#7372)
Feature: Implement required_conan_version in conanfile.py, will raise if the current Conan version does not match the defined version range. (conan-io/conan#7360). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add provides attribute to ConanFile: recipes can declare what they provide and Conan will fail if several recipes provide the same functionality (ODR violation). (conan-io/conan#7337). Docs: 📃
Feature: When using CONAN_V2_MODE if build_type or compiler are not defined Conan will raise an error. (conan-io/conan#7327). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds "filenames" to cppinfo attribute, and changes cmake_find_package and cmake_find_package_multi generators so that they support it. (conan-io/conan#7320). Docs: 📃
Feature: Define recipe_folder attribute pointing to the folder containing conanfile.py (conan-io/conan#7314). Docs: 📃
Feature: Checking if a Linux distro uses apt is now based on the existence of apt in the system, instead of checking if the distro currently being used is in a hard-coded list of distros known to use apt. (conan-io/conan#7309)
Feature: Add commands management for cli 2.0. (conan-io/conan#7278)
Feature: Complete revamp of the lockfiles feature. Including version-only lockfiles, partial lockfiles, new command line syntax, improved management of build-order and many pending fixes. (conan-io/conan#7243). Docs: 📃
Feature: More detailed description for --update argument. (conan-io/conan#7167). Docs: 📃
Feature: improve compiler detection for CONAN_V2_MODE. (conan-io/conan#5740). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add settings for clang-cl (clang on Windows). (conan-io/conan#5705). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax pluginbase requirement to pluginbase>=0.5, including latest 1.0.0 . (conan-io/conan#7441)
Fix: Make explicit the file writing of toolchain() helpers, so the method can be used to save custom files. (conan-io/conan#7435). Docs: 📃
Fix: Fixing --help for commands in proposal for command line v2.0. (conan-io/conan#7394)
Fix: Show outdated packages when running search --table. (conan-io/conan#7364). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax msbuild generator to not raise in Linux. (conan-io/conan#7361)
Fix: Conan config install does not trigger scheduled config command. (conan-io/conan#7311)
Fix: Implement missing __contains__ method, so checking if "myoption" in self.info.options is possible in package_id(). (conan-io/conan#7303)
Fix: Build first ocurrence of a node in a lockfile when it is repeated (build requires) (conan-io/conan#7144)
BugFix: Only add User-Agent to headers dict if it was not provided by the user. (conan-io/conan#7390)
Bugfix: cppstd was missing in settings.yml for the qcc compiler and updates to 8.3. (conan-io/conan#7384)
BugFix: Fix missing download of conan_sources.tgz created using export_sources() method. (conan-io/conan#7380)
Bugfix: Intel Compiler install location detection on Windows. (conan-io/conan#7370)
Bugfix: Avoid crash while computing package_id when using package_revision_mode, and also incorrectly using installed binaries and reporting them installed after the re-computation of package_id resolved to a different binary. (conan-io/conan#7353)
Bugfix: cmake_multi generator used with Xcode CMake generator. (conan-io/conan#7341)
Bugfix: Do not fail for conan remove -r remote -p when there are no packages in the remote. (conan-io/conan#7338)
Bugfix: Add system_libs to scons generator. (conan-io/conan#7302)

1.27.1 (10-Jul-2020)

Bugfix: Recover quotes around linker flags in CMake generators, fix failure with Macos frameworks (conan-io/conan#7322)




Commits

a08d79c bump version to 1.28.1
504160b Bugfix: correctly set CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT and CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES (#7512)
bdd2ce7 fixing application of build_requires to host context build_requires (#7500)
e157492 [fix] Propagate 'user_info_build' using package development commands (#7488)
448a701 components bug mixing build_type (#7492)
22df79b pkg_config generator: do not modify value in the shared 'cpp_info' object (#7...
ea65769 [tests] Move and add tests for the TXT generator (#7494)
5164a74 Hotfix/lockfile errors (#7453)
f529eff version 1.28.0

column21:
Bumps conan from 1.27.0 to 1.28.1.

Release notes
Sourced from conan's releases.

1.28.1 (06-Aug-2020)

Feature: Add user_info_build attribute to txt generator. (conan-io/conan#7488)
Fix: Attribute user_info_build is available for commands in the local development workflow. (conan-io/conan#7488)
Fix: Do not override value of public_deps in pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7482)
Bugfix: correctly set CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT and CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES. (conan-io/conan#7512)
Bugfix: When using build_requires defined in a profile that is passed as profile_host, it was not being applied to build_requires that live in the host context (with force_host_context=True). (conan-io/conan#7500)
Bugfix: Fix broken cmake_find_package_multi when using components, as different configurations were being resolved to the same name, overwriting each other. (conan-io/conan#7492)
Bugfix: Powershell files generated by virtualenv generators use proper path separators. (conan-io/conan#7472)

1.28.0 (31-Jul-2020)

Feature: Show Conan version on HTML output. (conan-io/conan#7443). Docs: 📃
Feature: Support for cpp_info.components in pkg_config generator. (conan-io/conan#7413). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds ps1 virtualenv to other OS for use with powershell 7. #7407 (conan-io/conan#7408). Docs: 📃
Feature: Propose init() method to unconditionally initialize class attributes like license or description. (conan-io/conan#7404). Docs: 📃
Feature: add deprecated attribute (conan-io/conan#7399). Docs: 📃
Feature: Allow conan.conf user configuration of paths to client certificate and key, outside of the Conan cache. (conan-io/conan#7398). Docs: 📃
Feature: Document return value of self.copy() in the package() method. (conan-io/conan#7389). Docs: 📃
Feature: Complete cli2.0 framework to handle sub-commands and add conan user command for cli 2.0 (conan-io/conan#7372)
Feature: Implement required_conan_version in conanfile.py, will raise if the current Conan version does not match the defined version range. (conan-io/conan#7360). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add provides attribute to ConanFile: recipes can declare what they provide and Conan will fail if several recipes provide the same functionality (ODR violation). (conan-io/conan#7337). Docs: 📃
Feature: When using CONAN_V2_MODE if build_type or compiler are not defined Conan will raise an error. (conan-io/conan#7327). Docs: 📃
Feature: Adds "filenames" to cppinfo attribute, and changes cmake_find_package and cmake_find_package_multi generators so that they support it. (conan-io/conan#7320). Docs: 📃
Feature: Define recipe_folder attribute pointing to the folder containing conanfile.py (conan-io/conan#7314). Docs: 📃
Feature: Checking if a Linux distro uses apt is now based on the existence of apt in the system, instead of checking if the distro currently being used is in a hard-coded list of distros known to use apt. (conan-io/conan#7309)
Feature: Add commands management for cli 2.0. (conan-io/conan#7278)
Feature: Complete revamp of the lockfiles feature. Including version-only lockfiles, partial lockfiles, new command line syntax, improved management of build-order and many pending fixes. (conan-io/conan#7243). Docs: 📃
Feature: More detailed description for --update argument. (conan-io/conan#7167). Docs: 📃
Feature: improve compiler detection for CONAN_V2_MODE. (conan-io/conan#5740). Docs: 📃
Feature: Add settings for clang-cl (clang on Windows). (conan-io/conan#5705). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax pluginbase requirement to pluginbase>=0.5, including latest 1.0.0 . (conan-io/conan#7441)
Fix: Make explicit the file writing of toolchain() helpers, so the method can be used to save custom files. (conan-io/conan#7435). Docs: 📃
Fix: Fixing --help for commands in proposal for command line v2.0. (conan-io/conan#7394)
Fix: Show outdated packages when running search --table. (conan-io/conan#7364). Docs: 📃
Fix: Relax msbuild generator to not raise in Linux. (conan-io/conan#7361)
Fix: Conan config install does not trigger scheduled config command. (conan-io/conan#7311)
Fix: Implement missing __contains__ method, so checking if "myoption" in self.info.options is possible in package_id(). (conan-io/conan#7303)
Fix: Build first ocurrence of a node in a lockfile when it is repeated (build requires) (conan-io/conan#7144)
BugFix: Only add User-Agent to headers dict if it was not provided by the user. (conan-io/conan#7390)
Bugfix: cppstd was missing in settings.yml for the qcc compiler and updates to 8.3. (conan-io/conan#7384)
BugFix: Fix missing download of conan_sources.tgz created using export_sources() method. (conan-io/conan#7380)
Bugfix: Intel Compiler install location detection on Windows. (conan-io/conan#7370)
Bugfix: Avoid crash while computing package_id when using package_revision_mode, and also incorrectly using installed binaries and reporting them installed after the re-computation of package_id resolved to a different binary. (conan-io/conan#7353)
Bugfix: cmake_multi generator used with Xcode CMake generator. (conan-io/conan#7341)
Bugfix: Do not fail for conan remove -r remote -p when there are no packages in the remote. (conan-io/conan#7338)
Bugfix: Add system_libs to scons generator. (conan-io/conan#7302)

1.27.1 (10-Jul-2020)

Bugfix: Recover quotes around linker flags in CMake generators, fix failure with Macos frameworks (conan-io/conan#7322)

a08d79c bump version to 1.28.1

448a701 components bug mixing build_type (#7492)
22df79b pkg_config generator: do not modify value in the shared 'cpp_info' object (#7...
ea65769 [tests] Move and add tests for the TXT generator (#7494)
5164a74 Hotfix/lockfile errors (#7453)

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.3.2.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.3.2 [Hotfix] Aug 7, 2020

Fixed incorrect warning code (W503->W0503).

5.3.1 Aug 7, 2020

Improve upgrade warnings to be less noisy and point to error codes for easy interoperability with Visual Studio Code (see: #1363).

5.3.0 Aug 4, 2020

Implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code (issue #1357)
Implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions (issue #1162)
Implemented ability to specify the types of imports (issue #1181)
Implemented ability to dedup import headings (issue #953)
Added experimental support for sorting literals (issue #1358)
Added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
Improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with Visual Studio Code (issue #1363)
Improved handling of mixed newline forms within same source file.
Improved error handling for known sections.
Improved API consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification API calls to indicate if changes were made.
Fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
Fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink

Internal Development:

Initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors (thanks @Zac-HD!)

5.2.2 July 30, 2020

Fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.
Implemented recursive symlink detection support.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".
Implemented #727: Ability to only add imports if existing imports exist.
Implemented #970: Support for custom sharable isort profiles.
Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #1020: Option for LOCALFOLDER.
Implemented #1353: Added support for output formatting plugins.
# isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.
Fixed #1348: --diff works incorrectly with files that have CRLF line endings.
Improved code repositories usage of pylint tags (#1350).

5.1.4 July 19, 2020




Changelog
Sourced from isort's changelog.

5.3.2 [Hotfix] Aug 7, 2020

Fixed incorrect warning code (W503->W0503).

5.3.1 Aug 7, 2020

Improve upgrade warnings to be less noisy and point to error codes for easy interoperability with Visual Studio Code (see: #1363).

5.3.0 Aug 4, 2020

Implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code (issue #1357)
Implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions (issue #1162)
Implemented ability to specify the types of imports (issue #1181)

Added experimental support for sorting literals (issue #1358)
Added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
Improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with Visual Studio Code (issue #1363)
Improved handling of mixed newline forms within same source file.
Improved error handling for known sections.
Improved API consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification API calls to indicate if changes were made.
Fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
Fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink

Internal Development:

Initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors (thanks @Zac-HD!)

5.2.2 July 30, 2020

Fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.
Implemented recursive symlink detection support.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".
Implemented #727: Ability to only add imports if existing imports exist.
Implemented #970: Support for custom sharable isort profiles.
Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #1020: Option for LOCALFOLDER.
Implemented #1353: Added support for output formatting plugins.
# isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.

5.1.4 July 19, 2020

column21:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.3.2.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.3.2 [Hotfix] Aug 7, 2020

Fixed incorrect warning code (W503->W0503).

5.3.1 Aug 7, 2020

Improve upgrade warnings to be less noisy and point to error codes for easy interoperability with Visual Studio Code (see: #1363).

5.3.0 Aug 4, 2020

Implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code (issue #1357)
Implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions (issue #1162)
Implemented ability to specify the types of imports (issue #1181)
Implemented ability to dedup import headings (issue #953)
Added experimental support for sorting literals (issue #1358)
Added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
Improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with Visual Studio Code (issue #1363)
Improved handling of mixed newline forms within same source file.
Improved error handling for known sections.
Improved API consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification API calls to indicate if changes were made.
Fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
Fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink

Internal Development:

Initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors (thanks @Zac-HD!)

5.2.2 July 30, 2020

Fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.
Implemented recursive symlink detection support.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".
Implemented #727: Ability to only add imports if existing imports exist.
Implemented #970: Support for custom sharable isort profiles.
Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #1020: Option for LOCALFOLDER.
Implemented #1353: Added support for output formatting plugins.
# isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
Fixed #1339: Extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.
Fixed #1348: --diff works incorrectly with files that have CRLF line endings.
Improved code repositories usage of pylint tags (#1350).

5.1.4 July 19, 2020

column20:
Bumps isort from 4.3.21 to 5.4.1.

Release notes
Sourced from isort's releases.

5.4.1 [Hotfix] Aug 13, 2020

Fixed #1381: --combine-as loses # noqa in different circumstances.

5.4.0 Aug 12, 2020

Implemented #1373: support for length sort only of direct (AKA straight) imports.
Fixed #1380: --combine-as loses # noqa.
Fixed #1375: --dont-order-by-type CLI broken.

5.3.2 [Hotfix] Aug 7, 2020

Fixed incorrect warning code (W503->W0503).

5.3.1 Aug 7, 2020

Improve upgrade warnings to be less noisy and point to error codes for easy interoperability with Visual Studio Code (see: #1363).

5.3.0 Aug 4, 2020

Implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code (issue #1357)
Implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions (issue #1162)
Implemented ability to specify the types of imports (issue #1181)
Implemented ability to dedup import headings (issue #953)
Added experimental support for sorting literals (issue #1358)
Added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
Improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with Visual Studio Code (issue #1363)
Improved handling of mixed newline forms within same source file.
Improved error handling for known sections.
Improved API consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification API calls to indicate if changes were made.
Fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
Fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink

Internal Development:

Initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors (thanks @Zac-HD!)

5.2.2 July 30, 2020

Fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.

5.2.1 July 28, 2020

Update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
Improved relative path detection for skip config usage.
Added recursive symbolic link protection.
Implemented #1177: Support for color output using --color.
Implemented recursive symlink detection support.

5.2.0 July 27, 2020

Implemented #1335: Official API for diff capturing.
Implemented #1331: Warn when sections don't match up.
Implemented #1261: By popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
Implemented #960: Support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=True".
Implemented #727: Ability to only add imports if existing imports exist.
Implemented #970: Support for custom sharable isort profiles.
Implemented #1214: Added support for git_hook lazy option (Thanks @sztamas!)
Implemented #941: Added an additional multi_line_output mode for more compact formatting (Thanks @sztamas!)

column20:
Bumps pre-commit from 2.6.0 to 2.7.1.

Release notes
Sourced from pre-commit's releases.

pre-commit v2.7.0
Features

Produce error message if an environment is immediately unhealthy

#1535 PR by @asottile.


Add --no-allow-missing-config option to init-templatedir

#1539 PR by @singergr.


Add warning for old list-style configuration

#1544 PR by @asottile.


Allow pre-commit to succeed on a readonly store.

#1570 PR by @asottile.
#1536 issue by @asottile.



Fixes

Fix error messaging when the store directory is readonly

#1546 PR by @asottile.
#1536 issue by @asottile.


Improve diff performance with many hooks

#1566 PR by @jhenkens.
#1564 issue by @jhenkens.






Changelog
Sourced from pre-commit's changelog.

2.7.1 - 2020-08-23
Fixes

Improve performance of docker hooks by removing slow ps call

column20:
Bumps black from 19.10b0 to 20.8b1.

Changelog
Sourced from black's changelog.

20.8b1
Packaging

explicitly depend on Click 7.1.2 or newer as Black no longer works with versions
older than 7.0

20.8b0
Black


re-implemented support for explicit trailing commas: now it works consistently within
any bracket pair, including nested structures (#1288 and duplicates)


Black now reindents docstrings when reindenting code around it (#1053)


Black now shows colored diffs (#1266)


Black is now packaged using 'py3' tagged wheels (#1388)


Black now supports Python 3.8 code, e.g. star expressions in return statements
(#1121)


Black no longer normalizes capital R-string prefixes as those have a
community-accepted meaning (#1244)


Black now uses exit code 2 when specified configuration file doesn't exit (#1361)


Black now works on AWS Lambda (#1141)


added --force-exclude argument (#1032)


removed deprecated --py36 option (#1236)


fixed --diff output when EOF is encountered (#526)


fixed # fmt: off handling around decorators (#560)


fixed unstable formatting with some # type: ignore comments (#1113)


fixed invalid removal on organizing brackets followed by indexing (#1575)


introduced black-primer, a CI tool that allows us to run regression tests against
existing open source users of Black (#1402)


introduced property-based fuzzing to our test suite based on Hypothesis and
Hypothersmith (#1566)


implemented experimental and disabled by default long string rewrapping (#1132),
hidden under a --experimental-string-processing flag while it's being worked on;






Commits

See full diff in compare view
